p: Some papers support the hypothesis that α-pinene is responsible for the antimicrobial action reported in the present study. In work by Leite et al. [ 45], this terpene was isolated and showed antibacterial activity against S. aureus and S. epidermidis. Other studies that identified α-pinene as a major constituent in the composition of essential oils from plants other than M. urundeuva also observed antibacterial activity against Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria [ 46– 49].
